Key Match Events: Tobias Harris recorded a double-double with 24 points and 10 rebounds.
Cade Cunningham supplied 18 points for Detroit, which has won five of its last six games.
Jalen Duren added 10 points and 14 rebounds.
Miles Bridges led Charlotte with 20 points, nine rebounds, and five assists.
Mark Williams had 18 points and nine rebounds for the Hornets.
Charlotte held a 65-52 lead at halftime.
The Hornets finished the opening half on a 18-6 run.
Detroit scored the first five points of the second half.
The Pistons reeled off a 12-2 run to take a 79-78 lead.
Cunningham hit a midrange jumper for a 94-90 lead with 3:10 left.
Hardaway clinched the Pistons' win with a free throw.
Post-Match Reflections: Detroit Pistons forward Tobias Harris had 24 points with 10 rebounds and the Detroit Pistons defeated the visiting Charlotte Hornets 98-94 in the NBA on Friday night.
